<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><Highlight kind="comment">/// A sum type over pointer-like types.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This is a normal tagged union across pointer-like types that uses the low</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"><Highlight kind="comment">/// bits of the pointers to store the tag.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Each member of the sum type is specified by passing a \\c</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><Highlight kind="comment">/// PointerSumTypeMember specialization in the variadic member argument list.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This allows the user to control the particular tag value associated with</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><Highlight kind="comment">/// a particular type, use the same type for multiple different tags, and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><Highlight kind="comment">/// customize the pointer-like traits used for a particular member. Note that</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><Highlight kind="comment">/// these &#42;must&#42; be specializations of \\c PointerSumTypeMember, no other type</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50"><Highlight kind="comment">/// will suffice, even if it provides a compatible interface.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="51"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="52"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This type implements all of the comparison operators and even hash table</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="53"><Highlight kind="comment">/// support by comparing the underlying storage of the pointer values. It</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="54"><Highlight kind="comment">/// doesn&#39;t support delegating to particular members for comparisons.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="55"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="56"><Highlight kind="comment">/// It also default constructs to a zero tag with a null pointer, whatever that</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="57"><Highlight kind="comment">/// would be. This means that the zero value for the tag type is significant</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="58"><Highlight kind="comment">/// and may be desirable to set to a state that is particularly desirable to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="59"><Highlight kind="comment">/// default construct.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="60"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="61"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Having a supported zero-valued tag also enables getting the address of a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="62"><Highlight kind="comment">/// pointer stored with that tag provided it is stored in its natural bit</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="63"><Highlight kind="comment">/// representation. This works because in the case of a zero-valued tag, the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64"><Highlight kind="comment">/// pointer&#39;s value is directly stored into this object and we can expose the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"><Highlight kind="comment">/// address of that internal storage. This is especially useful when building an</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66"><Highlight kind="comment">/// &#96;ArrayRef&#96; of a single pointer stored in a sum type.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68"><Highlight kind="comment">/// There is no support for constructing or accessing with a dynamic tag as</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"><Highlight kind="comment">/// that would fundamentally violate the type safety provided by the sum type.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/pointersumtype"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">template</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &lt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">typename</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> TagT, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">typename</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">... MemberTs&gt; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/pointersumtype/#af6a210a37ff26be591528765bbf55d98">PointerSumType</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="71"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">using </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">HelperT = <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/detail/pointersumtypehelper">detail::PointerSumTypeHelper</a>&lt;TagT, MemberTs...&gt;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="72"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="73"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We keep both the raw value and the min tag value&#39;s pointer in a union. When</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="74"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the minimum tag value is zero, this allows code below to cleanly expose the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="75"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// address of the zero-tag pointer instead of just the zero-tag pointer</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="76"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// itself. This is especially useful when building &#96;ArrayRef&#96;s out of a single</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// pointer. However, we have to carefully access the union due to the active</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// member potentially changing. When we &#42;store&#42; a new value, we directly</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// access the union to allow us to store using the obvious types. However,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// when we &#42;read&#42; a value, we copy the underlying storage out to avoid relying</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// on one member or the other being active.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">union </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">StorageT &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Ensure we get a null default constructed value. We don&#39;t use a member</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// initializer because some compilers seem to not implement those correctly</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// for a union.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"><Highlight kind="normal">    StorageT() : <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a066e2a31a13d6520e52ae1944f194662">Value</a>(0) &#123;&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00151" /><CodeLine lineNumber="151"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/pointersumtype/#ae551a2bdd6f1404ca525b69c51af7251">is&lt;HelperT::MinTag&gt;</a>() &amp;&amp; </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;The active tag is not zero!&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00152" /><CodeLine lineNumber="152"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Store the initial value of the pointer when read out of our storage.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00153" /><CodeLine lineNumber="153"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> InitialPtr = <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/pointersumtype/#ad93a065314b96efa75a7a9f7be6d7519">get&lt;HelperT::MinTag&gt;</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00154" /><CodeLine lineNumber="154"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Now update the active member of the union to be the actual pointer-typed</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00155" /><CodeLine lineNumber="155"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// member so that accessing it indirectly through the returned address is</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00156" /><CodeLine lineNumber="156"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// valid.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00157" /><CodeLine lineNumber="157"><Highlight kind="normal">    Storage.MinTagPointer = InitialPtr;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00158" /><CodeLine lineNumber="158"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Finally, validate that this was a no-op as expected by reading it back</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00159" /><CodeLine lineNumber="159"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// out using the same underlying-storage read as above.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00160" /><CodeLine lineNumber="160"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(InitialPtr == <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/pointersumtype/#ad93a065314b96efa75a7a9f7be6d7519">get&lt;HelperT::MinTag&gt;</a>() &amp;&amp;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00161" /><CodeLine lineNumber="161"><Highlight kind="normal">           </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;Switching to typed storage changed the pointer returned!&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00162" /><CodeLine lineNumber="162"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Now we can correctly return an address to typed storage.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00163" /><CodeLine lineNumber="163"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &amp;Storage.MinTagPointer;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00189" /><CodeLine lineNumber="189"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Read the underlying storage of the union, regardless of the active</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00190" /><CodeLine lineNumber="190"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// member.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00191" /><CodeLine lineNumber="191"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#aab3863f16cb0767af49f0dd63bc5aa90">bit&#95;cast&lt;uintptr&#95;t&gt;</a>(Storage);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00192" /><CodeLine lineNumber="192"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00193" /><CodeLine lineNumber="193"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00194" /><CodeLine lineNumber="194"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">protected</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00195" /><CodeLine lineNumber="195" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/pointersumtype/#af8d3f8f1f8cf1016d54a023abab2e82c"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/pointersumtype/#af8d3f8f1f8cf1016d54a023abab2e82c">getVoidPtr</a>()</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword"> const </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00196" /><CodeLine lineNumber="196"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">reinterpret&#95;cast&lt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">&gt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/pointersumtype/#ac9e4632ffcbba5320e94b99f03e90c74">getOpaqueValue</a>() &amp; <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/detail/pointersumtypehelper/#a0e0483d5325b9266682ff5e1dcd706faa9a36102b39902f39ba2d7c86e851a285">HelperT::PointerMask</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00197" /><CodeLine lineNumber="197"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00200" /><CodeLine lineNumber="200"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">namespace </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/detail">detail</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00201" /><CodeLine lineNumber="201"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00202" /><CodeLine lineNumber="202"><Highlight kind="comment">/// A helper template for implementing \\c PointerSumType. It provides fast</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00203" /><CodeLine lineNumber="203"><Highlight kind="comment">/// compile-time lookup of the member from a particular tag value, along with</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00204" /><CodeLine lineNumber="204"><Highlight kind="comment">/// useful constants and compile time checking infrastructure..</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00205" /><CodeLine lineNumber="205"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">template</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &lt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">typename</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> TagT, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">typename</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">... MemberTs&gt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00206" /><CodeLine lineNumber="206" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/detail/pointersumtypehelper"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">struct </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/detail/pointersumtypehelper">PointerSumTypeHelper</a> : MemberTs... &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00207" /><CodeLine lineNumber="207"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// First we use a trick to allow quickly looking up information about</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00208" /><CodeLine lineNumber="208"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// a particular member of the sum type. This works because we arranged to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00209" /><CodeLine lineNumber="209"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// have this type derive from all of the member type templates. We can select</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00210" /><CodeLine lineNumber="210"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the matching member for a tag using type deduction during overload</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00211" /><CodeLine lineNumber="211"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// resolution.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00212" /><CodeLine lineNumber="212"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">template</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &lt;TagT N, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">typename</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Po</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">int</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">erT, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">typename</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> TraitsT&gt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00213" /><CodeLine lineNumber="213"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/pointersumtypemember">PointerSumTypeMember&lt;N, PointerT, TraitsT&gt;</a></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00214" /><CodeLine lineNumber="214" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/detail/pointersumtypehelper/#ac6790710c23f2e09fbbd366c5b365214"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/detail/pointersumtypehelper/#ac6790710c23f2e09fbbd366c5b365214">LookupOverload</a>(<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/pointersumtypemember">PointerSumTypeMember&lt;N, PointerT, TraitsT&gt;</a> &#42;);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00215" /><CodeLine lineNumber="215" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/detail/pointersumtypehelper/#a133877d447fe8c73d27941db1ee1623d"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">template</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &lt;TagT N&gt; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/detail/pointersumtypehelper/#a133877d447fe8c73d27941db1ee1623d">LookupOverload</a>(...);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00216" /><CodeLine lineNumber="216" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/detail/pointersumtypehelper/lookup"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">template</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &lt;TagT N&gt; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">struct </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/detail/pointersumtypehelper/lookup">Lookup</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00217" /><CodeLine lineNumber="217"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Compute a particular member type by resolving the lookup helper overload.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00218" /><CodeLine lineNumber="218" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/detail/pointersumtypehelper/lookup/#a697bd470c937311f04be94c891ef9c58"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">using </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/detail/pointersumtypehelper/lookup/#a697bd470c937311f04be94c891ef9c58">MemberT</a> = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">decltype</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">(</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00219" /><CodeLine lineNumber="219"><Highlight kind="normal">        <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/detail/pointersumtypehelper/#ac6790710c23f2e09fbbd366c5b365214">LookupOverload&lt;N&gt;</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static&#95;cast&lt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/detail/pointersumtypehelper">PointerSumTypeHelper</a> &#42;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">&gt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">nullptr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">)));</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00220" /><CodeLine lineNumber="220"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00221" /><CodeLine lineNumber="221"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// The Nth member&#39;s pointer type.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00222" /><CodeLine lineNumber="222" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/detail/pointersumtypehelper/lookup/#a242d15402f9f4b955a3ac8dd68f4843f"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">using </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/detail/pointersumtypehelper/lookup/#a242d15402f9f4b955a3ac8dd68f4843f">PointerT</a> = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">typename</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> MemberT::PointerT;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00223" /><CodeLine lineNumber="223"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00224" /><CodeLine lineNumber="224"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// The Nth member&#39;s traits type.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00225" /><CodeLine lineNumber="225" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/detail/pointersumtypehelper/lookup/#a7f39b18e5874a27870e7e219fe82b309"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">using </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/detail/pointersumtypehelper/lookup/#a7f39b18e5874a27870e7e219fe82b309">TraitsT</a> = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">typename</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> MemberT::TraitsT;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00226" /><CodeLine lineNumber="226"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00227" /><CodeLine lineNumber="227"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00228" /><CodeLine lineNumber="228"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Next we need to compute the number of bits available for the discriminant</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00229" /><CodeLine lineNumber="229"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// by taking the min of the bits available for each member. Much of this</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00230" /><CodeLine lineNumber="230"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// would be amazingly easier with good constexpr support.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00231" /><CodeLine lineNumber="231"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">template</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &lt;uintptr&#95;t V, uintptr&#95;t... Vs&gt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00232" /><CodeLine lineNumber="232" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/detail/pointersumtypehelper/min"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">struct </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/detail/pointersumtypehelper/min">Min</a> : std::integral&#95;constant&lt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00233" /><CodeLine lineNumber="233"><Highlight kind="normal">                   uintptr&#95;t, (V &lt; Min&lt;Vs...&gt;::value ? V : Min&lt;Vs...&gt;::value)&gt; &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00234" /><CodeLine lineNumber="234"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00235" /><CodeLine lineNumber="235"><Highlight kind="normal">  template &lt;uintptr&#95;t V&gt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00236" /><CodeLine lineNumber="236" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/detail/pointersumtypehelper/min-ff3da524b068dd032e566ea1883afaf8"><Highlight kind="normal">  struct Min&lt;V&gt; : std::integral&#95;constant&lt;uintptr&#95;t, V&gt; &#123;&#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00237" /><CodeLine lineNumber="237" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/detail/pointersumtypehelper/#a78a6088ac065fefc180e7594f25c6552a89ff096aead3839255013f1e6c785902"><Highlight kind="normal">  enum &#123; NumTagBits = Min&lt;MemberTs::TraitsT::NumLowBitsAvailable...&gt;::value &#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00238" /><CodeLine lineNumber="238"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00239" /><CodeLine lineNumber="239"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Also compute the smallest discriminant and various masks for convenience.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00240" /><CodeLine lineNumber="240" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/detail/pointersumtypehelper/#a4092e609a5f36c3dc8a0b548c5b901db"><Highlight kind="normal">  constexpr static TagT MinTag =</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00241" /><CodeLine lineNumber="241"><Highlight kind="normal">      static&#95;cast&lt;TagT&gt;(Min&lt;MemberTs::Tag...&gt;::value);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00242" /><CodeLine lineNumber="242"><Highlight kind="normal">  enum : uint64&#95;t &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00243" /><CodeLine lineNumber="243" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/detail/pointersumtypehelper/#a0e0483d5325b9266682ff5e1dcd706faa9a36102b39902f39ba2d7c86e851a285"><Highlight kind="normal">    PointerMask = static&#95;cast&lt;uint64&#95;t&gt;(-1) &lt;&lt; NumTagBits,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00244" /><CodeLine lineNumber="244" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/detail/pointersumtypehelper/#a0e0483d5325b9266682ff5e1dcd706faac8ea40f18be819ba919f824292a6fbb6"><Highlight kind="normal">    TagMask = ~PointerMask</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00245" /><CodeLine lineNumber="245"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00246" /><CodeLine lineNumber="246"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00247" /><CodeLine lineNumber="247"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Finally we need a recursive template to do static checks of each</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00248" /><CodeLine lineNumber="248"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// member.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00249" /><CodeLine lineNumber="249"><Highlight kind="normal">  template &lt;typename MemberT, typename... InnerMemberTs&gt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00250" /><CodeLine lineNumber="250" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/detail/pointersumtypehelper/checker"><Highlight kind="normal">  struct Checker : Checker&lt;InnerMemberTs...&gt; &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00251" /><CodeLine lineNumber="251"><Highlight kind="normal">    static&#95;assert(MemberT::Tag &lt; (1 &lt;&lt; NumTagBits),</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00252" /><CodeLine lineNumber="252"><Highlight kind="normal">                  &quot;This discriminant value requires too many bits!&quot;);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00253" /><CodeLine lineNumber="253"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
